list_definition.definition: (sometimes with up) to (cause to) break in pieces or be ruined

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The plate dropped on the floor and smashed into little pieces
This unexpected news had smashed all his hopes
He had an accident and smashed up his car.

list_definition.definition: to strike with great force; to crash

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The car smashed into a lamp-post.

list_definition.mean_english: sự vỡ ra thành từng mảnh, sự đâm mạnh vào
list_definition.definition: (the sound of) a breakage; a crash

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A plate fell to the ground with a smash
There has been a bad car smash.
He gave his opponent a smash on the jaw.

list_definition.definition: in tennis etc, a hard downward shot

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She won the point with a powerful overarm smash.
